intro: Boisduvalia andina, commonly known as the Andean boisduvalia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Boisduvalia andina is often found in rocky or mountainous regions, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
